required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prescreening Protocol to Enroll in Food Allergy Clinical Studies at a Single Site
clinical_study.official_title: Prescreening Protocol to Enroll in Food Allergy Clinical Studies at a Single Site

collaborator.agency: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)

brief_summary.textblock: This is a protocol for prescreening of participants who would like to be in clinical studies in our Center at Stanford.

primary_outcome.description: Standardized Oral food challenges will occur in a staged manner to diagnose food allergies

secondary_outcome.measure: skin testing will occur to evaluate food allergen responses
secondary_outcome.description: Standardized skin testing will be performed to detect sensitivity to food allergens

biospec_descr.textblock: Blood will be collected, additional samples could include sputum, urine sample, stool sample, oral and nasal samples, skin samples

study_pop.textblock: Ages 1 wk-90 yrs will be screened and enrolled in this study to determine if they have a clinically-relevant food allergy. If so, they could be eligible for interventional clinical trials in the future.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Any individual with possible food allergy (as per their clinical history) who is interested in performing the gold standard food challenge for diagnosis.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any individual who does not consent
- Any individual who is currently taking oral steroids
- Any individual with moderate to severe asthma (FEV1<80%)

overall_official.affiliation: Stanford University, SNP Center for Food Allergy and Asthma Research

facility.name: The Sean N. Parker Center for Allergy and Asthma Research, Stanford University
